metadata.title: CVE-2022-4515 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in Exuberant Ctags in the way it handles the "-o" option.This option specifies the tag filename. A crafted tag filename specified inthe command line or in the configuration file results in arbitrary commandexecution because the externalSortTags() in sort.c calls the system(3)function in an unsafe way.

criterions.comment: exuberant-ctags: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
